title: For Season 10 - Riot needs to be honest with themselves about the state of matchmaking.
body: The trend towards strong mismatches was very well noticed, documented and discussed on these boards for season 9. Its time to stop pretending like this isn't an issue negatively impacting the game and address it directly.

replies.body: The system needs to stop hiding MMR especially that is what matters for matches, not rank, rank is literally useless in all regards except dick measuring.
dick measuring is also invalid this season due to the jacked up MMR.

Once upon a time, before the Tier system was put in place (in season 6 if I'm not mistaken) your rank was based on your MMR, which was visible. Everyone started off at 1200 and gained or lost points from there, if you passed a certain threshold, you went from Bronze to Silver to Gold, etc. No promo matches, no LP, just MMR.

No, this is stupid. If you do this, the players will not sacrifice to save their adc, you'll see players playing KDA only, or safely farming all game. If you reward anything but victory, you place secondary objectives that are worth Lps in the game, and some player, when they feel a game is lost, will start optimizing these metrics.

This is not the kind of game you want.

If i'm 0-10-0 down 100 farm, but I keep dragging the whole other team attention, while you take nashor, drakes, towers it's fine, I did my part.

The problem with your proposition is if the toplaner gets camped and dove again and again by the top/jungler premade, he'll have low stats, but a smart jungler on the opposing team will just get his bot ahead and they'll end up crushing the game because a fed top is not worth a fed botlane.

Why would you punish the toplaner in this case ? He's had a bad game so the botlane could shine and win the game, he should be rewarded more to compensate for this.

The only goal on this game is not farming, not having levels, not killing opponents, not stealing the jungle or hitting skillshots. The race condition to win is to kill at least 5 towers, one inihb and a nexus. Nothing else.

If you come up with a strategy like inting sion and you manage to do this while being 0/25/0 and withtout killing a single minion, WP, you deserve your victory, it's up to the game designer and the balance team to decide if this is an acceptable strategy and fixing this.

I know exactly what doing well means. That's why I argue against those that DONT do well and not in favor of them like you do. Precisely because people dont understand the simple concept youre trying to use in your argument, destroying the nexus. Most people will chase kills around jungle when they oughta be staying away from deaths so the opponent doesnt get fed, while we're all pushing lanes to get to the Nexus. And in the way of course theres going to be fights, but thats when you show what you got. But the feeders usually dont play like that. They treat SR like its ARAM and fuck up the game's balance. And when they finally get back to the real game its too late and everyone else gets fucked out of LP.

So its not about whos getting rewarded for doing what, its about whos not getting screwed over for other people's mistake. Take away more LP from feeders and less from people who dont. And sure sometimes you might die 7 times by mid game.. but then end up carrying with 22 kills and pretty much leading the team to victory in every team fight. So there has to be a system that can detect that. But this whole thing about "ooh your top laner went 0/9/2 by min 12 and now their top is ripping through your team while everyone else is averaging 1/0/1 - 2/1/0... And you end up having to FF?"  .....What happens now? Fuck it.. you all lose LP.

> I know exactly what doing well means. That's why I argue against those that DONT do well and not in favor of them like you do. Precisely because people dont understand the simple concept youre trying to use in your argument, destroying the nexus.

No you don't. I'm d3 and I don't.

I can see sometimes when someone is not doing well but i'm far from being able to quantify it, and most of the time i'm not even able to say if someone is doing badly because he was camped or because we didnt follow him.

The easiest way of tracking the winning moves is rewarding the the winning team.

If you do a lots of winning moves in multiples games, it will average a higher winrate. That's all.

Also remember that LPs are worthless. You earn and lose hidden mmr each matches and that's what gives you more or less LPs.

The simple way to implement what both of you are saying is to have the games ranked system be objective based, yeah you went 28/0/10 but you had zero impact on towers or dragons or barons, so you get the a lower lp reward, versus your top laner who went 4/15/20 got herald, and tp ganked bot for dragons and towers and even though he lost the game, his superior skill at rotating and impacting the game should be rewarded rather than punished.  The game already tracks everything from kills and deaths to towers dragons and barons, use those statistics to change the system, let the game be based purely on a single persons impact on the game and team rather than kills and deaths.

Well, now you went 28-0 because you got a quadra top on your own then you had to back while your team kills herald and drake, none of this would have happened without you.

You see how hard it is to implement ? The Lp gains is already objectives based. The team killing the other teams nexus wins full LP. The team which lost its nexus loses full LP.

That's the easiest way to reward winning strategies against losing ones.

I don’t know how matchmaking was in early seasons but currently it’s HORRIBLE. My account is Silver 3 (yes Ik I have a lot to learn) and I’m finding myself getting more and more frustrated with climbing. Or at least attempting to and not getting anywhere. What happens is when I am 0 LP S4, I go on a massive win streak and hard carry games until I get to around 50 LP S3. When I say hard carry I mean a typical game as Kat of like 20/4. During this win streak, riot matches me with ppl who may or may not feed a little bit but at worst, they realize that I’m going to carry them and play safer. However, once I get to mid S3 for some reason I then get matched with absolute r%%%%%s who will squander my 6/0 lane lead as quickly as I got it. I’m talking your typical bot lanes who have a combined 10+ deaths at 10 minutes or less, or a top lane that is 0/6 with 40 cs down and is hard engaging every chance they get no matter how many times I’ve tried to warn them. U may say that it’s bound to happen sometime but it truly happens to me every time I cross the S3 50 LP threshold. The only way I win beyond that is to play a flawless game, and obviously I’m in silver so that can’t happen all the time. Is riot basically telling me that I have to preform like a Plat smurf every game to climb past silver 3? Before you all say “if your good enough you’ll climb easily” I whole heartedly disagree. You get better from playing competitive games. But having an 0/11 Ashe and some troll auto filled support who picks something off meta, or a teemo that feeds the enemy garen to a nice 8/0 does not make for competitive games. Not to mention the amount of weird picks I see that decide the game at champ select because everyone wants to pick a squishy carry no matter what the role or comp is and everyone wants to build all dmg or ap. Or the amount of whack runes I see (ex: electrocute Braum). I figured making the Iron division would help keep high bronze and beyond more competitive and keep the trolls, hard feeders, inters, or anyone who seemingly doesn’t even care enough to check online to see if their build is right out of matches with people who actually do care and want to climb. I was wrong and I think it’s even worse now. I understand silver is low elo and if I was really good I would climb quickly. But how do u expect me to get that good when the matches are not competitive in the slightest and every match has at least one hard feeder who basically makes the game a blowout very quickly. Who can I play that isn’t at the whim of feeders? I want to play good games that make me better at the game. 
DISCLAIMER: this is my friends account I’m posting from bc I don’t care for a bunch of ppl criticizing my gameplay as I realize I have a lot to learn, my problem is I’m not learning anything from people inting in my games.
Truthfully this is really ruining my league of legends experience and sometimes I’d rather be playing Fortnite nowadays, and I don’t enjoy fortnite.

In addition, if u look at my friends account here, you’ll see why he is starting to not enjoy the game either. He wants to play ranked and probably stacks up well against high bronze atm. However, he plays with high silver low gold players. He earns 30 LP per win and loses 10 per loss. The dream right? No, because he clearly isn’t good enough to play gold players yet and is getting tired of ruining their games and getting flamed. How many games must he ruin until riot finally puts him with low silver or high bronze where he belongs? How is matchmaking not broken?

Yeah the sad reality is that you have few options aside from play like a Plat smurf or one-trick a hard-carry champion (personally I chose Kat, though she's probably not the best option,) and that got me to gold for the first time this season, almost plat now after playing ~800 games with her on several different accounts...

So yeah, the time investment is ridiculous if you want to actually 1v9 a good portion of your games instead of relying on the coinflip. It takes wayyyy too long right now.
you get the rank that riot wants you to have. everything works as planned for riot.

>
> maybe an ELO system could work for Flex?

It can work in the case of premade 5. In that case, you may treat a "team" as a single (virtual) "player", assigning LP gains/losses to teams themselves (not to players). In such a case, you could have a team-ladder, completely separated from other ladders, like "Ranked 5". For example, you may have Team A with MMR 2000 (something like Plat) and Team B with MMR 1500. Note: the fact that Team A has MMR 2000 does not imply that every single player has, individually, MMR 2000. This is just the "uniform" approximation, it may or may not be true.

Of course, this would not resolve the issues of ranking a player in SoloQ, since using its "team-rank" would basically amount to the same approximations that are made in the case of MMR, and you would be back to square one.
